results.title: Kathy's pacing horse
results.brief_description: Looks at the life style of seventeen-year-old Kathy Sargent who lives in a sheep station in southwest Western Australia.

results.title: Kariba game rescue
results.brief_description: The rising waters of the Kariba Dam, largest man made lake in the world, threatened the wildlife in the area until Northern Rhodesian rescue teams put Operation Noah into practice. A typical day’s work is the capture of boatloads of game, such as antelope and zebra and their safe release on dry land.

results.title: Kangaroo creek gang: ...`do the right thing'
results.creator_credit: David Kefford, Terry Watt and Kangaroo Creek Gang
results.brief_description: An animated video which encourages primary school children to “Do the right thing’ when disposing of rubbish. Encourages children to place rubbish in bins and to sort for recycling. This video is part of a kit which includes an audiotape with songs and advice to teachers.

results.title: Kandinsky
results.brief_description: Working his way from totally familiar to abstract forms, Wassily Kandinsky changed the course of modern art in an exuberant mastery of colour. His Russian origin is stressed and his later turn towards the fine arts with a philosophic metaphysical outlook are emphasised.
results.description: Working his way from totally familiar to abstract forms, Wassily Kandinsky changed the course of modern art in an exuberant mastery of colour. His Russian origin is stressed and his later turn towards the fine arts with a philosophic metaphysical outlook are emphasised.

results.title: Kanagawa: between sea and mountain
results.creator_credit: A Hidaka, T. Ogura and Asia Film
results.brief_description: Shows Kanagwawa prefecture on the rugged sea coast of Japan and the great national park. Trees provide the material for the many traditional and modern handcrafts of the area - objects d’art, lacquer, silk scarves, wood carving and decorative articles and screens made from sea shells. Reclaimed submerged trees are also used. By contrast, we see the great industrial complex of Yokohama city, a bustling harbour from which Japanese exports are shipped to every part of the world.

results.title: Just one kid
results.brief_description: An autobiographical look at the life of a Jewish boy growing up in London during the 1930’s providing a nostalgic impression of the Jewish community in London’s East End at that time. Highlights cultural traditions, continuity and change and the social conditions in the 30’s.

results.title: Jungle road
results.brief_description: Papua and New guinea today, showing the terrain, people and customs; technical training of the natives; development of agricultural schemes and health services carried out by the New Guinea administration; role of the Twenty-First Construction Squadron of Royal Australian Engineers building new roads, providing electric power and telephone services, constructing houses, a jetty and an airstrip. A new road being built through the rugged Torricelli Mountain range from Wewak to Maprik.

results.title: Departure
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
In Departure, Ian Andrews has used mostly analogue techniques to evoke the decaying process that occurs in a film or photographic image over time, but in doing so, he has created an altogether different visual landscape in which different layers of image contest and compete against each other.
A small strip of found film footage of a man “departing” loops endlessly back and forth, and as it does so, the repeated actions of the man seem to physically alter the layers, the skin of film and image through which we watch this action take place. The figure is marking out the landscape by traversing it, by exiting the frame and leaving a ghostly trace of his presence - but it is the surface of the visual form itself that is left marked.
